line_1: Her peaceful shores, where busy commerce waits
line_2: To pour his golden tide through all her gates,

line_1: Ambition knocks, and fleeting Beauty waits;
line_2: To court thy pencil early at thy gates,

line_1: Who for the distant Ship impatient waits,
line_2: He the deep Seas prefers to noisy Straights,

line_1: Far from the Shore the wily Sucker waits
line_2: The coming Ship, but him the Sailor hates.

line_1: With these the subtle Angler patient waits,
line_2: The Prey entangles, and her Hunger fates.

line_1: By wicked Elders chain'd, Redemption waits,
line_2: Tho', cloath'd with sackcloth, Justice in the gates,

line_1: For there no stranger ever waits;
line_2: In vain the arts unfold their gates,

line_1: On Isis still each gift of Fortune waits,
line_2: Still Peace and Plenty deck my beauteous gates.

line_1: Whilst Ulme th' Approach of her Deliv'rer waits,
line_2: And longs to open her obsequious Gates.

line_1: The furious Will on Fancy waits;
line_2: Too late advances or too soon retreats.

line_1: Once more a son of SPENCER waits,
line_2: A name familiar to thy gates,
